title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Film and Video Editors

content.rendered:
What are Film and Video Editors?

Film and Video Editors are in charge of managing and editing together the final product of a film or video.

Where do Film and Video Editors work?

  • Radio and television programs
  • Motion picture companies
  • Freelance

How much do Film and Video Editors make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Film and Video Editors is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Film and Video Editors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Film majors
  • Media studies majors
  • Communications majors
Search relevant jobs

Film and Video Editor skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Film and Video Editors succeed in their work:

  • Knowledge of video editing programs and softwares
  • Attention to detail
  • Creativity

What are some common questions about Film and Video Editors?

Q: How do I become a Film and Video Editor?

A: The majority of editor positions require at least a bachelor’s degree in video production or a related field. If you haven’t finished your degree yet, it’s a good idea to apply to related internships or part-time jobs in the meantime to grow your experience and understanding.
